Game

Class Pet

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game.Species
      • Game.Pet

  • public class Pet
extends Species
    The Pet Class is for initializing Pet objects, their attributes and calculating attribute changes between rounds.

    Each player object can have up to 3 unique Pet Objects. Pets have multiple "actions" that a player can use on a pet.

    Author:
    Jade Martin, Kyran Stagg

    • Constructor Detail

      • Pet

        public Pet()

    • Method Detail

      • updateHealth

        public void updateHealth()
        This Method refreshes the Health of a Pet every round depending on the other pet attributes. Specifically Sickness which subtracts 10 from the health.

      • sleep

        public void sleep()
        This Method is called when a pet is put to sleep. It counts as one player action. It restores +20 to a Pets Tiredness.

      • bathroom

        public void bathroom()
        This Method is called when a Pet uses the Toilet. It counts as one Player action. It restore 20 to the Pets Toilet Level and Reduces the pet weight by 2.5.

      • play

        public void play(Toys inputToy)
        This Method is called when a Pet plays with a Toy Object. It counts as one Player action. It restores 20 to the pets playfulness and if the Toy is a pets favorite, it will restore an additional 20.
        Parameters:
        inputToy - Toy A Toy object to be used by the Pet.

      • feed

        public void feed(java.lang.Integer nutritionValue,
                 Food inputFood)
        This Method is called when a Pet is being feed with a food object. It counts as one player action. It restores hunger by the amount of the foods nutrition level. But takes away 2 times the nutrition value from toilet level.
        Parameters:
        nutritionValue - This is the input nutrition value of the food to be feed.
        inputFood - This is the Food object from the player inventory to be feed.

      • getPetSpecies

        public java.lang.String getPetSpecies()
        This Method gets the species of a pet and returns it of type Species.
        Returns:
        Species This returns the Species

      • setPetSpecies

        public void setPetSpecies(Species petSpeciesInput)
        This Method is used to set the Species of a Pet Object and inturn, get the weight and damage of the pet.
        Parameters:
        petSpeciesInput - This is the Species to be set for the given pet.

      • getPetDead

        public java.lang.Boolean getPetDead()
        This Method Returns a Boolean value. True if the pet is dead and false if the pet is alive.
        Returns:
        Boolean The Death status of the Pet.

      • setPetDead

        public void setPetDead(java.lang.Boolean petDeadInput)
        This Method sets the Dead Boolean of a pet. True being dead and False being alive.
        Parameters:
        petDeadInput - This is the Boolean to be set as the death state of the pet.

        Returns:

        Parameters:

      • getRevived

        public java.lang.Boolean getRevived()
        This method returns the boolean of if the Pet object has been previously revived.
        Returns:
        Boolean Has the Pet been revived before.

      • revivePet

        public void revivePet()
        This method Revives a Pet and sets its death status to false. It also resets the pets statuses to their defaults.

      • isDead

        public void isDead()
        This Method Displays if a pet is dead or has died.

      • rollMisbehavouring

        public void rollMisbehavouring()
        This Method Will determine if a pet is Misbehaving. There is a one in five chance of a pet starting to misbehave.

      • rollSickness

        public void rollSickness()
        This Method Will determine if a pet is Feeling Sick. There is a one in five chance of a pet starting to feel Sick.

      • drainStats

        public void drainStats()
        This Method is used at the end of a round to recalculate the status of a Pet Object. It also Calls necessary methods for the end turn phase.
